fields.description:
Hi guys,

I run reporting with SSRS and I just completed a manual update form Jira v4.2.4 to v6.1.2 and I've just noticed that certain fields are showing up as NULL, like the pkey field from the jiraissue table.

I've run reindexing and that has not fixed the issue.

Please help,
Jason

fields.description:
avatarpicker.jspa button does not seem to do anything when you click on it. I've just finished upgrading my Jira 4.2.4 to the latest 6.1 version of Jira and while playing with the functions noticed that my icons were missing. When trying to upload new user or project avatars I can't seem to get past browsing for my image, then selecting the part of the image to upload and then the "Confirm" button does not seem to do anything.

Please help.
Jason Chung
613-226-1117 x213

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35664].
  {panel}

The Windows installers and screenshot applet need up to date certificates. We use 2-year certificates. To ensure we're always up to date we should be pro-actively updating these on a semi regular basis. These take a while to come through once we put in requests to IT, so this should be done in early 2014 so that we:
* have time to request tickets from IT and incorporate them
* our product continues to work for some period after release.

The current round of certificates expire in early 2015. See JRA-31345.
fields.summary: New certificates for Windows installer

Hi,

For me it's absurd to create this issue again.

In spite of lots of comments on JRA-5865, issue was resolved as "Wont-Fix" which prevents all the customer base to vote for this issue.

For me it's incredible that this feature is not present. It's vary basic!!! Lot's of folks agree with me and the comments are there but noone can vote for it.

I Think there's a company that implemented a plugin for that but it's not on Demand solution. We need that!!!
fields.summary: Restrict creation of a specific issuetype to a specific group or project role

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35657].
  {panel}

h3. Summary of Bug

When using Firefox (tested with 24), certain attachments are unable to be loaded. During the first try to access the attachment, the popup is empty, and all subsequent tries to access the attachment will return an error : {{The requested content cannot be loaded. Please try again later.}}

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Use the image 'Unbenannt.png' (attached to this ticket) as an attachment in JIRA
# Try to access the attachment

h3. What we know
* Issue only happens when using Firefox (Chrome and IE works fine)
* The affected attachments are only .png image files
* Not all .png files are affected; new ones can be viewed fine. However, attachments that are at least a few days old will face this issue.
* In Firefox 24, and JIRA 5.2, (with their attachment) I could reproduce the behavior in my local instance (own data)
* In Firefox 24, JIRA 6.1, their attachment could be viewed fine
* In Chrome, the attachment could be viewed regardless of JIRA version
fields.summary: Firefox fails to render certain attachments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35655].
  {panel}

In our documentation : https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Upgrading+JIRA check the part of the table : 
bq. earlier than 4.0.0	[Upgrading JIRA with a Fallback Method|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Upgrading+JIRA+with+a+Fallback+Method]
But when you go to the page : https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Upgrading+JIRA+with+a+Fallback+Method it says: 
bq. This page describes how to upgrade JIRA 4.4.x or later 


This is inconsistent and needs fixing.
fields.summary: JIRA upgrade guide needs fixing

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35653].
  {panel}

Through the JIRA administration and customization interface many fields have the option to either "Config" or "Edit" the field. There does seem to be some logic to how these are applied (Edit changes the item itself, configure changes how the object is used?) but it's quite confusing for new administrators and adds extra complexity even for experienced admins.

Any chance of improving the admin UI? It's all through setting up custom fields and screens.

The overall meta-model of configuring JIRA is complicated enough.

Thanks! Love your product.
fields.summary: Confusion between "Config" and "Edit" in Admin UI

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35652].
  {panel}

The way it is now:

If you create a shared dashboard, the issues on the issue widget are completely unconfigured; you get a default random sort order. 

The way it should be:

The owner of a shared dashboard should be able to configure the issue widget so have a default sort order, including ascending and descending options for the widget columns.
fields.summary: Shared Dashboards Issue Widget should allow creation of default sort orders
"where is my field" order results alphabetically

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35650].
  {panel}

The way it is now:

You can only sort by columns which are also displayed.

The way it should be:

You should be able to sort by columns which are not displayed, possibly by changing the widget configuration.
fields.summary: Dashboard Issue Widget should allow sorting by hidden columns

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35649].
  {panel}

The way it is now:

1. create a dashboard issue gadget with a "Created Date" column.

2. click on the created date column twice to sort it descending

3. log out of Atlassan Online

4. log back in

5. issues list is not sorted again.

The way it should be:

- issues list should be sorted how you left it, or there should be a "save sort" option, or you should be able to create a sort order in the Dashboard configuration.
fields.summary: Dashboard Issue Gadget should save sort order

fields.description:
We have several users who are still using IE 8 for accessing our JIRA instance. There is a bug that we can reproduce over and over where a user clicks on the CREATE issue button and instead of the popup dialog box like this screen a different screen appears.

The screen has issues because what is filled in on the Create Issue box is ALL of the PROJECTS and ALL of the ISSUE TYPES regardless of what project(s) the specific user has access to. This causes confusion because people can open Issues to projects they don't have access to, including, having difficulty creating the proper issue type because all issue types are appearing, not just the one for the project they created.

We like to know what the work around would be, since we still have user base that is using IE 8.
fields.summary: IE 8 Issues when opening issues in JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35646].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Open the Issue Navigator in List view.
# Add the "∑ Progress" column.
# Drag the newly-added column to somewhere other than the very right-most position. It disappears.
# Re-add the ∑ Progress column, try dragging any other column anywhere else, and the ∑ Progress column still disappears.

Can reproduce in standalone 6.1.0 and OnDemand 6.2-OD-1.
fields.summary: "Ʃ Progress" column in Issue Navigator disappears if you re-order any columns

fields.description:
We have 4 customised fields DFS estimate, Dev estiomate, QA estimate and UAT estimate and each of these is updated as part of the workflow, a step for each one. But the problem is we need a total of all of them to be inserted as the original estimate. Can we change orginal estimate to do this? We can't even seem to change the orginal estiame after it's had an entry entered except by adding a work log and changing remaining estimate. 
Please can you advise with some help on this.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35628].
  {panel}

These instructions to install JIRA on Mac OSX need to be updated for Mavericks https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Installing+JIRA+on+Mac+OS+X#InstallingJIRAonMacOSX-1.DownloadandInstallJIRA

Following instructions on a related Stack Overflow issue (http://stackoverflow.com/questions/19533528/installing-java-on-os-x-10-9-mavericks): 
1. Install the correct version on Java http://support.apple.com/kb/DL1572?viewlocale=en_US
2. Set JAVA_HOME as instructed

Also, the readme file in the download version has instructions for Linux, Solaris & Windows, but not Mac. That's ok, but would be nice to call out that Mac is unsupported, or link to relevant documentation if you want to attempt install on Mac OS X.
fields.summary: Update instructions for installing on MAC OS X

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35627].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition


When a user goes to the issues navigator to search for issues it automatically displays all issues that user has permissions to view. While this is useful some users with very large instances wait up to a couple of minutes for that load to finish so they can search for issues.

h3. Suggested Solution
A General Config setting to disable this functionality if you need would be great!

h3. Workaround
Users can create a purposely broken filter and save that as a link to their instance. This way every time they navigate via that link the issue navigator will automatically come up with no issues and they won't have to wait.
fields.summary: Add the ability to stop the issue navigator from auto loading all issues when first navigating there
Field API does not return field description

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35623].
  {panel}

Some data types (ntext, text, image) will be officially discontinued in future releases of Microsoft SQL server, as stated by Microsoft in this page:

- http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms187993.aspx

We want the Atlassian tools to adjust these modifications and modify some of the existing data types to match the new supported ones by Microsoft.

i.e.: _changeitem_ table is one table from JIRA which currently uses _ntext_.
fields.summary: Adjust MS SQL datatypes for future releases

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35622].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:

* Create a test issue and add two or three users as a watcher
* Export the backup of this instance
* Import the project using the "Project Import" tool
* When the import is complete, check the issue that had the watchers
* Try removing the watchers, they should disappear from the watchers list
* Refresh the issue, the watchers will still be listed

This is caused by the *watches* column not matching the number of rows in the *userassociation* table.

For example, here are the list of watchers of issue 10008:

{code:sql}
jira=# select * from userassociation where association_type = 'WatchIssue' and sink_node_id = 10008;
 source_name | sink_node_id | sink_node_entity | association_type | sequence |          created           
-------------+--------------+------------------+------------------+----------+----------------------------
 user 1      |        10008 | Issue            | WatchIssue       |          | 2013-11-01 18:36:20.324+00
 user 2      |        10008 | Issue            | WatchIssue       |          | 2013-11-01 18:36:20.321+00
 sysadmin    |        10008 | Issue            | WatchIssue       |          | 2013-11-01 18:36:20.314+00
(3 rows)
{code}

And that's not being taken under consideration on the watches column of the jiraissue table:

{code:sql}
jira=# select id, project, issuenum, watches from jiraissue where project = 10003 and id = 10008;
  id   | project | issuenum | watches 
-------+---------+----------+---------
 10008 |   10003 |        3 |       0
(1 row)

jira=# 
{code}

The following query can help detect all the issues that have the watches columns not matching the number of watches:

{code:sql}
select count(*) as total, sink_node_id, i.id, i.watches, p.pkey, i.issuenum 
  from userassociation, jiraissue i , project p
 where association_type = 'WatchIssue' 
 and i.id = sink_node_id
 and i.project = p.id
group by sink_node_id, i.id, i.watches, p.pkey, i.issuenum 
having count(*) != (select watches from jiraissue where jiraissue.id = userassociation.sink_node_id);
{code}

Workaround: update the watches column on *jiraissue* table to match the number of watchers of the issue in the *userassociation* table:

{code:sql}
UPDATE jiraissue i
SET watches = 
(SELECT COUNT(*) 
FROM userassociation
WHERE association_type = 'WatchIssue' 
AND userassociation.sink_node_id = i.id );
{code}
fields.summary: Cannot delete watchers from an issue that was imported using the Project Import
Cascading from one field type to another field type

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35620].
  {panel}

When you have a lot of shared code, the same bug/issue may come up on multiple products if that bug/new feature is in a shared library.  

Currently, there we have to Clone and then Move an issue to a new project.  This is very tedious, time consuming and prone to human error/forgetfulness.

One idea would be to add extra fields that link an issue to other projects and keep track of the {{Fix Version/s:}} for that other project.  When you click Resolve issue, it could prompt you to fill in the Fix Version for the other projects, too, although that could be delayed as well.

The trick is having that issue show up in other projects queries as if it were a first-class issue in those projects.

Another idea is to add a special "Clone in other Project" action that creates the new issue in the other project and tracks it as described above.  This could be as simple as adding a choice of what Project to put a Clone into on the Clone action window.  This would at least collapse the Clone and then Move actions into one action which would be a start, assuming the cloned bug is linked strongly to the original issue.

(Note: we use JIRA OnDemand - so it should work there too)
fields.summary: Track an Issue across multiple Products
Cloning an issue documenation should mention what field values would not be retained in the clone

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

Use the Activity display mode, next to All, Comments, Work Log, and History or the Activity Stream dashboard gadget.
The 'Read more' link can appear in 2 places:
1. If the description of the issue is too long to display: Clicking on this will take you to the top of the current issue. *This works fine*
2. If the latest comment which appears inside of a blue box is too long to display: 'Read more' looks like a link but *doesn't work* when clicked and there is no URL displayed in the browser status bar when mouse-over.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35604].
  {panel}

It seems that project import will not remap the status IDs to the new ones when you do a project import.

Let's say that on the exported database you have New = 1, Accepted =5 and on the target system you have New = 3 and Accepted = 7 (as there is no way to force their IDs).

Project import will work but when you check the history you will see the old IDs there.

The implications on these are quite big because this will complete break all the statistics, especially the ones made by GreeenHopper : burncharts, velocity...
fields.summary: jira project import does not remap issue state changes from changeitem table
XSS in Dashboard

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35601].
  {panel}

*Steps to Reproduce*

* Add a value to either 'Affects Versions' or 'Components' field of an issue from the default issue view page using the inline edit feature.
* Try to add the same value again, you initially get 'No Matches' on the field (because the value has been added previously), when you click out of the field, you get the following message:

"Version with id '1.0' does not exist." or "Component with id 'blablabla' does not exist." as the case may be

In a case where there are a lot of versions or components added, it's more helpful to have a more descriptive or accurate error message returned like: "version '1.0' has already been added" or "component 'blablabla' has already been added" as the case may be.

*Note*:
This also occurs on the edit screen pop up.
fields.summary: When you try to add 'Affected Version' or 'Component' that is already added, via inline edit, JIRA reports id does not exist.
As an Administrator, I would like to set up resolution schemes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35597].
  {panel}

h3. Summary of Bug
When using Internet Explorer (9 or 10), certain attachments are not able to be viewed. When the user tries to view them, they instead get a 'The requested content cannot be loaded. Please try again later.' error message.

h3. What we know
* This only occurs for jpg image attachments
* This does not occur for all jpg image attachments
* When using other browsers, it works fine
fields.summary: Internet Explorer fails to render certain attachments
JIRA Date & People Field Position on Screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35595].
  {panel}

As of JRA-27544 the description field is cleared when using the "Create another ticket" option. However, the description field is the most beneficial field to persist to the new issue because there may be even a single sentence or line in the description that you will want to keep.  It takes only 3 key presses (CTRL+A, Del) to clear the entire contents of a description field.  However, to re-type even a single line, sentence, paragraph, or something as long as reproduction steps would take an exponentially more amount of time.

This should definitely be changed back to allow the description field to persist especially since you made the "Feature Change" as a "Bug" in a previous minor release without properly notifying your users or administrators of the change. The change enacted by the bug should have never been classified as a bug due to the original feature implementation of the "create another" checkbox. By definition it was put in place to aid in the creation of a new issue by persisting fields, but the responsibility is still on the reporter to review ALL fields for relevance to the new issue being created. Therefore, it should have been a feature enhancement or new feature.

There was mention to statistics or analytics that were used to make the decision in the "Bug" that removed this functionality.  I would like to see these analytics that you are referring to. Were the analytics based solely on if the description field was changed or if the description field was 100% different from the previous description? That right there would make a huge difference in how to proceed with this feature. If just parts of the description were different from the previous one, then it should not be cleared, but if your analytics show that the description was completely changed each time, then i would agree that it should probably be cleared.  Also, where were these "analytics" captured?  If they were only on your OnDemand solution, that is most likely more of your newer customers and smaller companies that don't have the resources to house an on-premise solution.  All of your older customers and larger companies are more than likely still using on-premise solutions and aren't going to upgrade to every version.  Now that you are up to 6.1.2, you will see more larger companies starting to migrate from version 5, and therefore more companies are going to notice this change and also complain.

However, if we follow through on this logic and boil it down to the essence of why the description field should be cleared, the underlying reason is that the user has to review the field and make any necessary changes to fit the new issue. If you use that reasoning, then it would mean that you should be clearing ALL fields for the new issue because then that would force the user to review every field and make the necessary changes.

You need to either persist all fields and put the responsibility on the reporter that they will review all fields and make changes as needed for the new issue, or eliminate the confusion and clear all fields back to defaults when using the "create another" checkbox, thus forcing the user to re-evaluate all fields and set them accordingly.

An alternative method to make this into a true Improvement would be to change the behavior to persist ALL fields, but give the flexibility to specify which fields should not be persistent between issue creations.  I can think of other fields which would benefit more from being cleared than the description field, such as the Priority field, or any other business critical Custom Field that an organization has implemented.

Please let me know if you have any questions regarding this.  If needed, i can instruct my entire company to log into this issue, vote for it, and comment on it describing how much they all use this feature, and how much this change is affecting their workflow and causing them to waste more time during issue creations.
fields.summary: Retain the description field when "Create Another" checkbox is selected

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35578].
  {panel}

There are *{color:red}2 issues{color}* that appear to be going on here....

h4.The 1st issue - Remaining Estimates (Create an Issue)
When I create a new or edit an Issue, and I try to set the Remaining Estimates to "Leave Estimates Unset", the radio button for Leave Estimates Unset is chosen.  However when I go to log work, I am getting an error that states 'Remaining Estimates is Invalid".  

If I go back into the edit mode of the Issue to see if my setup is still set on Leave Estimates Unset, I see that is has changed to Adjust automatically.  It is not saving my choice selection.

h4. The 2nd issue - Log Work
When I choose the Log Work and I make my entries into the pop-up box, if I put "0" in the Remaining Estimates field, they system auto changes that entry to display "N/A".  

However, if I delete the N/A and reenter the "0" again, they system takes  that entry and I am able to log work.  Is this a current bug issue or does this currently work this way?
??This appears as a bug with a workaround to remove the N/A and enter the "0" or whatever value to be able to proceed further.??

??{color:blue}This does not matter is I config my screen to display the log time fields when a user creates an Issue or not{color}??
fields.summary: Remaining Estimates and Logging Work

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35576].
  {panel}

My request is to let the users configure which versions to be displayed first ; released or unreleased.
Or let me know if there is a workaround.
In our case we have tens of released versions, and our field targeted fix version is supposed to pick up one of the upcoming versions however since upcoming versions are displayed after released versions, every time we have to scroll down to select one of our upcoming versions.

As this specifically relates to grouping and sorting of released vs. unreleased, this issue is *NOT* a duplicate of JRA-21677.
fields.summary: As a Project Administrator, I'd like to order Version Picker controls to show Unreleased before Released.
Show Description for fields during Inline Editing of an issue
As an admin, I would like to receive a notification once active user count is close to reaching the license limit.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35571].
  {panel}

Currently, if making a REST API request to JIRA to get results of worklog for example:

- https://<instance-url> rest/api/latest/issue/ISSUE-4?fields=timespent,worklog

It won't show results of worklog if that field is hidden in the field configuration in JIRA, once that setting is set to "SHOW" the results will be returned.

It would be great to note this in the API documentation that JIRA will respect field settings.
fields.summary: Clarify that JIRA REST API requests doesn't show results for hidden fields

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35570].
  {panel}

We are using the JAM plugin to sync alm defects with Jira.
As of this month the sync doens't work anymore.
When i edit the connection settings betweet jira and alm it comes back with the same error:
Please make sure
1. JIRA server can reach http://jiraserver:8088/MercuryInterface/MercuryInterface
2. Quality Center URL is correct

i've checked the url's and they are reachable.

Where in the log can i find the error? And how do we resolve this issue
fields.summary: ALM plugin doens's sync anymore

fields.description:
Hi
I want to reduce the notifications sent by Jira.
Indeed my email provider does not want messages sent exceeds a quota.
We send nearly 5,000 notifications per day, you have a solution to reduce this number.
When my provider blocks all system notifications are stuck in the queue.
The provider considers that a certain number, it is spam being sent
What can be done?
Regards
fields.summary: Reduce notification sent by Jira

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35540].
  {panel}

When rendering page - for example https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/Dashboard.jspa - Chrome browser (reproducable also in FF) makes some requests to ifr resources, then it cancels it and makes them again. Example in attached screenshot (request marked in red are cancelled, and then repeated)

This behavior causes delay in rendering and also generates load on server side causing performance problems

This happens on my internal jira, but can be also reproduced in public https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/Dashboard.jspa instance (user not logged in).

It looks like every "filter results" causes one cancelled and one successful request.
fields.summary: browser creates multiple request to ifr (for same resources)
Unable to switch between preview/list view in search page

Filter UI issue
make project planning easier
Make inline editing retrieve latest state of issue from server

fields.description:
My Virtual machine where down for some reason; after contacting my admin to reset it or something, Jira failed to launch with the following error

The following plugins are required by JIRA, but have not been started:
Gadget Directory Plugin (com.atlassian.gadgets.directory)

Can you please tell me the reason for this error and how to fix it.
fields.summary: Jira startup failed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35518].
  {panel}

Right now, I can only list my favourite issues through the REST API (i.e. {{/rest/api/2/filter/favourite}}).

I would like to have access to all of the filters:
* List all the personal filters
* List all the visible filters
* Search filter by keyword
fields.summary: As an Atlassian Connect developer, I would like to query all the filters through the REST API
Rewrite documentation
